title: Recognize Signs of Survival Stress and Distress
brief: Identify physical and mental warning signs of excessive stress that can impair survival decision-making.
steps: Monitor yourself and others for difficulty making decisions or angry outbursts.
Watch for forgetfulness, low energy levels, and constant worrying.
Identify propensity for mistakes and trouble getting along with others.
Notice withdrawal from responsibilities or other people.
Check for carelessness in critical survival tasks.
Be alert for thoughts about death or suicide in yourself or team members.
Take immediate action to address stress through rest, food, or task reorganization when signs appear.
warnings: Excessive stress can cause panic and make you forget all survival training.
Cumulative minor stressors can create major distress if they occur close together.
Thoughts of suicide indicate critical stress requiring immediate intervention.
source: FM 21-76 US Army Survival Manual — US Department of the Army (Chapter 2)
